channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Ketan Joshi
item.description: If Australia sets a ‘net zero by 2050’ target at COP26, it will likely be heralded as a major shift, but it’s unlikely to do anything to align us with that trajectory.
item.title: How do we tackle Australia’s burning problem before it burns us?

item.dc:creator: Jon Faine
item.description: Branch stacking rewards unethical behaviour and breeds cynicism towards all parties. It needs to be stamped out.
item.title: Stacked to the rafters

item.dc:creator: Karl Quinn
item.description: Brooke Blurton has a remarkable backstory – not that we’ll likely get much more than hints of it on the show.
item.title: Why we should all hope the new Bachelorette gets her happy ending

item.description: Like every good novelist, he’s a complicater. He insists that we’re all made from crooked timber, and there are no easy answers in life.
item.title: Twitter might hate Jonathan Franzen, but serious readers love him

item.description: She shot to fame in the ’90s as the face of an iconic Wonderbra campaign. Now Eva Herzigová has a fresh perspective that’s driving her to make a difference.
item.title: How surviving COVID changed model Eva Herzigová’s outlook on life

item.description: Facing tragedy at a young age would lead the operatic soprano’s life in an unexpected direction.
item.title: The one person Nellie Melba was so desperate to please

item.description: “We are not married, much to the horror of my Islander family, but having babies lets me off the hook.”
item.title: Art Works’ Namila Benson on why she feels ‘weird’ about marriage

item.description: This would be why I turned up to an appointment a whole 24 hours early, and why I’ve lost my wallet – inside my house.
item.title: There’s only so much bandwidth in our brains and mine is full

item.dc:creator: Annika Smethurst
item.description: Changes to home gatherings and travel limits may be made by next weekend.
item.title: Andrews to announce extra freedoms on Sunday

item.dc:creator: Melissa Cunningham
item.description: Orthopedic surgeons, consultant physicians, theatre staff, neurologists and even psychiatrists are being relocated into emergency departments and COVID-19 wards, as sections of hospitals are closed down entirely.
item.title: Victorian hospitals make seismic changes to handle tsunami of the unvaccinated

item.dc:creator: Adrian Proszenko
item.description: Just when she thought the saga was finally over, the woman at the centre of the Tyrone May sex tape scandal had to relive the entire ordeal.
item.title: ‘Wake up to yourself’: Woman at centre of Tyrone May sex scandal breaks silence

item.dc:creator: Christian Nicolussi
item.description: Jason Demetriou believes his five-year apprenticeship under Wayne Bennett will make sure it’s a smooth succession at South Sydney.
item.title: Demetriou confident he can end the curse of the supercoach

item.dc:creator: The Herald's View
item.description: It’s a great day for the people of NSW after the state hit its long-awaited 80 per cent vaccination target.
item.title: Patience and empathy needed as we re-emerge into changed world

item.dc:creator: Christian Nicolussi
item.description: Craig Bellamy has no interest in letting any contracted players leave the Storm to join Redcliffe before their deals expire.
item.title: Hands off: Bellamy issues warning on Storm stars

item.dc:creator: Jacqueline Maley
item.description: The later-life difficulties of working women are mostly ignored – and women are reluctant to bring them up.
item.title: Why older women dare not mention the M word

item.dc:creator: Andrew Wu
item.description: A generation of Australia’s male cricketers run the risk being remembered more for sandpaper than silverware.
item.title: Why Australia’s men need to start winning – and soon

item.dc:creator: James Massola
item.description: Angus Taylor will make a direct pitch to Nationals MPs over climate policy, but it’s not clear whether the Nationals will sign on to net zero.
item.title: Taylor to address Nationals’ meeting as MPs warn ‘this is not a done deal’

item.dc:creator: James Massola
item.description: If the Greens hold the balance of power after the next federal election, the party it wants to build 1 million affordable homes over 20 years.
item.title: Greens promise huge cash splash to build 1 million affordable homes

item.dc:creator: Parnell Palme McGuinness
item.description: It’s unclear who feels more betrayed by News Corp’s new Mission Zero campaign.
item.title: When bad news is good News: accepting climate change shouldn’t mean denying it will hurt jobs

item.dc:creator: Peter FitzSimons
item.description: And why asking passengers to be double jabbed is the right thing to do.
item.title: ‘We just want our aircraft back in the air’: Alan Joyce on why prices won’t be sky-high when travel returns

item.description: I have been looking at a photo of my son on his first day at school. He looks awkward in his uniform. He had spent his life to that point in fancy dress.
item.title: My son’s final day of school is a turning point in both our lives

item.dc:creator: Tom Cowie
item.description: Of all the restrictions that Melbourne has lived under for the past two years, the curfew has been one of the most controversial. At some point next week, it will finally be lifted.
item.title: No more ‘papers, please’: Farewell to the curfew; never bring it back

item.description: About one in seven women and one in 700 men will be diagnosed with the disease in their lifetime. Most survivors go on to live normal lives, but many say they view life very differently.
item.title: ‘I thought it was a woman’s disease’: What it’s like to live with breast cancer

item.dc:creator: Andrew Wu
item.description: We take a look at the leading contenders to lift this year’s men’s Twenty20 World Cup.
item.title: Twenty20 World Cup guide: Big guns take aim at short-form showpiece

item.dc:creator: Peter FitzSimons
item.description: Spy, photographer, writer, cameraman, explorer, war hero, air ace: Hubert Wilkins deserves more credit for his many achievements.
item.title: Hubert Wilkins: Australia’s forgotten hero was a visionary

item.dc:creator: Michaela Whitbourn
item.description: Ruth McColl, SC, a former NSW Court of Appeal judge, first presided over an ICAC inquiry in 1996 when she examined unsavoury practices at Glebe Morgue in Sydney. Now she is examining dealings on Macquarie Street.
item.title: The seasoned jurist presiding over Berejiklian’s ICAC inquiry

item.dc:creator: Nathanael Cooper
item.description: Sydney has a desperate lack of commercial theatre space. Putting new ones in casinos is not the answer.
item.title: Forcing audiences into casinos to see theatre is just what Sydney doesn’t need

item.dc:creator: Lisa Visentin
item.description: When Harry Harding landed in Beijing for a holiday a decade ago he did not have enough clothes to get through winter. Now he is one of the few Australians working for Chinese state media.
item.title: ‘I don’t think I’m working for the devil’: The Australians still working in Chinese media

item.description: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson on Saturday laid flowers outside the church where a lawmaker was stabbed to death a day earlier, in what police say was a terrorist attack probably linked to Islamist extremism.
item.title: British PM Boris Johnson visits church where MP was stabbed to death

item.description: Eric M. Smith, who was 13 when he killed a four-year-old boy with a rock in western New York, has been granted parole, according to corrections officials.
item.title: Teenage killer of four-year-old boy granted parole on 11th try

item.description: Illustrations by the artist from The Age.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Matt Golding

item.description: A selection of his best work.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Matt Davidson

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, October 17, 2021

item.dc:creator: Linda Morris
item.description: Reigniting the economy through cultural offerings is a priority for Treasurer Matt Kean.
item.title: Festivals, theatres win $86 million lifeline to get back on feet

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, October 16, 2021

item.dc:creator: Matt O'Sullivan
item.description: Premier Dominic Perrottet confirmed NSW would ease restrictions to allow 20 visitors in homes and the return of community sport, as well as indoor dancing and drinking.
item.title: ‘Summer is looking good’: NSW hits 80% target, pushes for students and tourists to return

item.dc:creator: Caitlin Fitzsimmons
item.description: The former premier, who led arguments against voluntary euthanasia in NSW in the 1990s, said other Australian states had proven that voluntary assisted dying laws could work.
item.title: ‘I sure as hell want it’: Bob Carr changes mind, supports assisted dying laws

item.dc:creator: Jordan Baker
item.description: Some primary school parents don’t think the benefits of masks outweigh the downsides. Others think it’s a small price to pay for safety.
item.title: To mask or not to mask? The question facing parents as school resumes

item.dc:creator: Lucy Manly
item.description: Popular in fashion crowds and celebrities circles, Nagnata founders Laura May and Hannah Gibbs refuse to in-person trading until all customers are welcome.
item.title: Celebrity models support Byron studio’s controversial vaccination stance

item.dc:creator: Andrew Taylor
item.description: Australians performed $30 billion worth of unpaid help in 2020, but the COVID-19 crisis stopped many people volunteering more of their time and skills to help others.
item.title: ‘Too many people undervalue themselves’: Do we need to put a dollar value on helping others?

item.dc:creator: Andrew Taylor
item.description: The proposal for multimillion-dollar apartments overlooking one of Sydney’s largest urban parks has outraged some locals.
item.title: Court to decide on plans for 350 units at Sydney Park as locals seek green space

item.dc:creator: Anne Hyland
item.description: OneSchool Global, which is associated with the Plymouth Brethren Christian Church, a group that refers to outsiders as “worldlies”, has received an estimated $9 million in JobKeeper payments.
item.title: JobKeeper payments made to school linked to ‘extremist cult’

item.dc:creator: Andrew Taylor
item.description: The future of Oxford Street is set to become a political hot potato ahead of delayed local government elections in December.
item.title: ‘This will make Darlinghurst hum’: The plan to transform Taylor Square

item.description: Free weekly horoscope for each star sign. From October, we’ll no longer be publishing daily horoscopes. Instead, you can find a weekly forecast in life, love and career from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari right here every Sunday.
item.title: Your Weekly Horoscope for October 17-24

item.dc:creator: Andrew Hornery
item.description: The Harbour City is losing the celebrity throne. We can no longer be smug about our once glittering pantheon of stars.
item.title: Sydney can only watch with envy as Kylie comes home ... to Melbourne

item.dc:creator: Caitlin Fitzsimmons
item.description: Will NSW become the last state in Australia to pass laws allowing voluntary assisted dying? Here’s what’s at stake on both sides of the debate.
item.title: Voluntary assisted dying debate centres on what makes a good death

item.dc:creator: Caitlin Fitzsimmons
item.description: The International Organisation for Standards has new requirements for sex toys covering design, body-safe materials and consumer information. But compliance is voluntary.
item.title: ‘Better than nothing’: Sex toy industry adopts voluntary safety standards

item.dc:creator: Linda Morris
item.description: New plans to restore the Minerva theatre at Kings Cross have the backing of leading theatre names.
item.title: $35 million price tag to restore the Minerva to a 1000-seat theatre

item.description: Why is the state government replacing polluting diesel ferries with new polluting diesel ferries?
item.title: Fresh thinking, a ferry good idea

item.dc:creator: Jack Latimore
item.description: For decades Blak media have been truth-telling for anyone prepared to pick up a paper, turn the dial or log on, but now their reach is growing.
item.title: A rising force: how Blak media rewrote the script from its own ground
